intro: Pedicularis subnuda, commonly known as the naked beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine or subalpine habitats, often in rocky or gravelly soils. Its flowers, which are usually pink or purple, attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Pedicularis subnuda is a perennial herb that blooms from late spring to early summer.
